summary:
14. Urges the GNU to complete the national census and prepare for free and fair elections.

15. Urges UNMIS to prepare for election support, including developing a national strategy, and encourages international community assistance.

16. Encourages UNMIS to assist in national reconciliation and peacebuilding, emphasizing women's and civil society roles.

17. Calls upon parties to support, protect, and facilitate humanitarian operations and personnel.

18. Welcomes returns of IDPs and refugees, encourages sustainable returns, and requests UNMIS to facilitate returns.

19. Expresses concern at localized conflict and violence, urging cooperation for civilian protection and supporting UNMIS's conflict management strategy.

20. Notes conflict interconnections, urging UNMIS to coordinate with stakeholders for complementary mandate implementation.

21. Requests UNMIS to facilitate recovery and development assistance.

22. Calls upon the GNU to cooperate with UN operations.

23. Requests a report on possible measures for UNMIS to assist with a future LRA peace agreement.

24. Reiterates concern over restrictions on UNMIS personnel and materiel, calling for cooperation and compliance with international humanitarian law.

25. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure UNMIS compliance with the zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

26. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
